intro: Chamabainia cuspidata var. denticulosa, commonly known as the toothed chamabainia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves with finely serrated edges, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers shaded to partially shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
